title: Expenses and benefits: employee liabilities and indemnity insurance

details.description: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing employee liabilities and indemnity insurance
details.alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for employee liabilities and indemnity insurance
details.body:
As an employer, you might have to report the costs of employee liabilities and indemnity insurance you provide for your employees. You don’t have to pay tax or National Insurance on these costs.

Employee liabilities and indemnity insurance covers your employees if someone takes them to court because of a mistake they make at work.

What to report

What you must report depends on how much an employee or director earns.

Who gets the benefit What to do What to deduct or pay
Employees earning at a rate of less than £8,500 a year Nothing Nothing
Employees earning at a rate of £8,500 or more a year Report on form P11D, section M (unless you have a dispensation) Nothing
Directors Report on form P11D, section M (unless you have a dispensation) Nothing

Include the total cost to you of the legal or insurance expenses for each employee.
